newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Coconut Oil-Rising supply seen weighing on prices.
newsitem.headline: Coconut Oil-Rising supply seen weighing on prices.

text.p: Coconut oil prices are expected to drop because of increasing supply from the Philippines, vegetable oils traders said on Monday.
"Softening domestic prices due to rising supplies will definitely spill over into Rotterdam," a senior Manila trader said.
Coconut oil in Manila fell to 16.20 pesos per kg on Monday from 16.70 pesos last week, while copra dropped to 10 pesos from 10.50, the trader added.
Traders they expected prices of coconut oil in Rotterdam to drop further after losing an average of $15 per tonne CIF last week.
Trade group United Coconut Association of the Philippines said coconut oil was quoted at $620 per tonne CIF for June/July shipment on Monday while sellers quoted $627.50.
Coconut oil stocks in Rotterdam fell to 8,148 tonnes as of June 30 from the previous week's 9,539 tonnes.
"But even if stocks are low in Rotterdam, buyers seem at ease because of the scheduled arrivals of new shipments from the Philippines this week," said one trader.
